intro: Tragopyrum polygamum, commonly known as the purple globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive purple to reddish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and sagebrush steppe. It has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and produces small, round seed pods. Tragopyrum polygamum is adapted to arid environments and is considered a perennial herb.
